required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Clinical Trial of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Clinical Trial of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a Phase II, single-arm, open-label, single-dose clinical trial, and its primary objective is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the treatment of relapsed or refractory NHL.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a Phase II, single-arm, open-label, single-dose clinical trial, and its primary objective is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CNCT19 Cell Injection in the treatment of relapsed or refractory NHL. The study consists of screening period (8 weeks), treatment period (4 weeks), and follow-up period (2 years at most).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Remission Rate (ORR), which includes Complete Remission (CR) and Partial Remission (PR)
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy of CNCT19 as measured by ORR during the 3 months after CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion, which includes CR and PR.

secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of CNCT19 as measured by CR during the 3 months after CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion.
PFS means duration from the CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion to progression of lymphoma, or death for any reason.
DFS means duration from the beginning of complete remission to relapse of disease, or death (for any reason).
DOR means the duration from reaching the response (e.g., CR or PR) criteria of the therapy to the first, clearly defined progressive disease, or death for disease under investigation.
The best overall response after CNCT19 infusion.
OS means duration from the CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion to death for any reason, or the last follow-up for survival.
TTR means duration from the CNCT19 Cell Injection infusion to the first response (irrespective of PR or CR, which comes first).

arm_group.description: A conditioning chemotherapy regimen of fludarabine and cyclophosphamide will be administered followed by investigational treatment, CNCT19.

intervention.description: Dose: 2.00 x 10^8 CNCT19 Cell Injection via intravenous infusion. Drug: Fludarabine Drug: Cyclophosphamide

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital
